classes.title: CZCH280
classes.subtitle: Closely Watched Trains: Czech Film and Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course examines Czech film and literature against the backdrop of key historical, political, and cultural events of the 20th century. Films with English subtitles. Readings and discussions in English.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH401
classes.subtitle: Elementary Czech I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course examines Czech film and literature against the backdrop of key historical, political, and cultural events of the 20th century. Films with English subtitles. Readings and discussions in English.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH401
classes.subtitle: Elementary Czech I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Proficiency-based instruction at the elementary level that develops the four language skills (speaking, listening, reading, writing). In addition to mastering basic vocabulary and grammar, students will communicate in Czech about everyday topics.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Czech II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Proficiency-based instruction at the elementary level that develops the four language skills (speaking, listening, reading, writing). In addition to mastering basic vocabulary and grammar, students will communicate in Czech about everyday topics.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH402
classes.subtitle: Elementary Czech II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Continuation of the proficiency-based instruction in CZCH�401. Course emphasizes speaking, listening, reading, writing in a cultural context. Students enhance their basic vocabulary and grammar and will regularly communicate in Czech about everyday topics.Requisites: Prerequisite, CZCH�401; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Gen Ed: FL.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH405
classes.subtitle: Advanced Czech I.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced readings and discussion in Czech in humanities and social science topics.Requisites: Prerequisite, CZCH�404; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH406
classes.subtitle: Advanced Czech II.  3 Credits.

classes.title: CZCH406
classes.subtitle: Advanced Czech II.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced readings and discussion in Czech in humanities and social science topics, continued.Requisites: Prerequisite, CZCH�405; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH411
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Czech Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Advanced readings and discussion in Czech in humanities and social science topics, continued.Requisites: Prerequisite, CZCH�405; permission of the instructor for students lacking the prerequisite.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH411
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Czech Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to Czech literature with an emphasis on 19th- and 20th-century prose. Taught in English. Some readings in Czech for qualified students.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH469
classes.subtitle: Milan Kundera and World Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Introduction to Czech literature with an emphasis on 19th- and 20th-century prose. Taught in English. Some readings in Czech for qualified students.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: CZCH469
classes.subtitle: Milan Kundera and World Literature.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course traces Milan Kundera's literary path from his communist poetic youth to his present postmodern Francophilia . His work will be compared with those authors he considers his predecessors and influences in European literature. Taught in English. Some readings in Czech for qualified students.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: CMPL�469.

classes.title: CZCH490
classes.subtitle: Topics in Czech Culture.  3 Credits.
classes.description: This course traces Milan Kundera's literary path from his communist poetic youth to his present postmodern Francophilia . His work will be compared with those authors he considers his predecessors and influences in European literature. Taught in English. Some readings in Czech for qualified students.Gen Ed: LA, BN.Grading status: Letter gradeSame as: CMPL�469.

classes.title: CZCH490
classes.subtitle: Topics in Czech Culture.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Study of topics in Czech and/or Slovak literature and culture not currently covered in any other course. The specific topic will be announced in advance. Taught in English. Some readings in Czech for qualified students.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit; may be repeated in the same term for different topics; 12 total credits. 4 total completions.Grading status: Letter grade.
